news.title: Trump objected to Zelenskyy's tone and body language in Oval Office clash, White House says
news.summary: Zelenskyy challenged the idea that Ukraine can rely on diplomatic guarantees by Russia. He said Putin launched the war in 2022, and Ukraine can't rely on him to stop it.

news.title: Microsoft resolves global outage that left tens of thousands unable to access email and other apps
news.summary: The outage left tens of thousands of users unable to access their Outlook email accounts and other programs. Microsoft said service was restored following the outage.

news.title: Another 'near miss': Citigroup mistakenly credited a customer account with $81 trillion
news.summary: Citigroup mistakenly credit a customer's account with $81 trillion last year when it meant to send just $280. Citigroup: We mistakenly credited a customer’s account with £81 trillion when it was actually £280.

news.title: Top Wall Street analysts are upbeat on the long-term potential of these stocks
news.summary: TipRanks' analyst ranking service spotlights three stocks favored by Wall Street. Booking Holdings and Visa are two of the stocks highlighted.

news.title: Social Security has never missed a payment. DOGE actions threaten 'interruption of benefits,' ex-agency head says
news.summary: New changes at the U.S. Social Security Administration may put its ability to deliver monthly benefit checks at risk, former agency head says.

news.title: A dear friend, 91, wants to add me to the deed of his house. His daughter died and he’s not close to his son. Is that a good idea?
news.summary: “What is the best way to add my name, so there are no issues upon his death?” he asks. “What are the best ways to add his name so there’s no issues after his death?"

news.title: ‘I’m an endless honey pot’: My wife and I are in our 70s. We gave our son $40,000 for his L.A. wedding. Now he wants more.
news.summary: “We financed three of them through college, so none of our kids have student loans,” his wife says. “We have four sons. We financed three and we’re going to finance four more.”

news.title: My dying cousin ‘fell in love’ with his hospice nurse after 4 months. She inherited his entire estate. What can I do?
news.summary: “‘He wasn’t married and didn't ever have children,’’ said a friend. “’He wasn't married and Didn’ts Have Children’s’ was his response.

news.title: ‘I’ve nothing left for retirement’: My husband and I have 9 kids and $70,000 in student debt. How do we pay it off?
news.summary: “We own our home and have about $30,000 in equity,” she says. “We’re very happy. We’ve never been happier.”

news.title: ‘Why am I so afraid to retire?’ I’m 60 and lost $1.2 million in a divorce. Can I rebuild my life?
news.summary: “If the rule of 4% is applied, I could use savings and the proceeds from my house sale to buy a condo, and at 62 draw $110,000 per year,” he says.
